list.title: Private Guided Tours
list.subtitle: Explore our curated private tours across Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay.

br-iguacu-br.short: Panoramic views of the Iguazu Falls from Brazil.
br-iguacu-br.intro: Experience the best panoramic viewpoints of Iguazu Falls on the Brazilian side. Boardwalks and platforms reveal the full grandeur of this Natural Wonder.
highlights: Great for photography at golden hour
includes: Assistance with park tickets (tickets not included)
tips: Bring a light rain jacket for mist

br-itaipu-night.short: Night light show at the Itaipu Dam.
br-itaipu-night.intro: Discover the impressive Itaipu Dam under a spectacular night lighting. Learn about its engineering and history with a private guide.
tips: Bring a light jacket at night

ar-iguacu-ar.short: Immersive trails over and under the falls in Argentina.
ar-iguacu-ar.intro: Walk the extensive trails and catwalks on the Argentine side for an immersive perspective, including access to the Devil’s Throat walkway.

ar-gran-aventura.short: Adrenaline boat ride close to the waterfalls.
ar-gran-aventura.intro: Combine jungle ride and an exhilarating boat experience that approaches the falls for a soaking adventure.

py-shopping-cde.short: Guided shopping experience in Ciudad del Este.
py-shopping-cde.intro: Cross into Paraguay for a curated shopping tour in Ciudad del Este, with guidance on trusted stores and customs.
tips: Cards and cash accepted in most stores

py-saltos-monday.short: Visit the scenic Saltos del Monday waterfalls.
py-saltos-monday.intro: Discover the beautiful Saltos del Monday in Paraguay, a tranquil complement to the Iguazu experience.

left.title: LET US GUIDE YOU
left.p1: Welcome to the heart of South America, where three nations meet in perfect harmony. We are a locally-owned tourism agency based in Foz do Iguaçu, Brazil, specializing in unforgettable experiences across the Triple Frontier region.
left.p2: For over a decade, we've been connecting travelers with the breathtaking wonders where Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay converge. Our expert guides bring the rich cultural tapestry of this unique region to life, offering authentic insights that only locals can provide.
left.p3: From the thundering majesty of Iguazu Falls to the vibrant markets of Ciudad del Este, and the charming streets of Puerto Iguazú, we curate experiences that showcase the best of three countries in one incredible destination.
left.p4: Whether you're seeking adventure, culture, natural beauty, or all of the above, our carefully designed tours ensure you don't miss a single highlight.
left.p5: We believe travel is more than just seeing places—it's about creating lasting memories. With small group sizes, personalized attention, and a passion for our homeland, we guarantee tours that are as enriching as they are enjoyable.
left.p6: Let us show you why the Triple Frontier is one of South America's most extraordinary destinations.
left.p7: Discover three countries. Experience one unforgettable journey.

card1.title: Private Tours
card1.text: Personalised, private New Zealand tours with expert guides who share their local knowledge, plan your day, and offer.

iguassu.title: Iguassu Falls Tours
iguassu.desc: The premier attraction of the Triple Frontier. Tours must cover the National Parks in both countries: the Brazilian side for the breathtaking, panoramic views and the Argentine side for a deeply immersive experience, featuring extensive trails over and under the cascades, leading to the famed Devil’s Throat. Easy border crossing allows you to enjoy the unique perspectives of this Natural Wonder over separate days.

adventure.title: Adventure Tours
adventure.desc: The wild nature of the border region provides the perfect setting for high-energy activities. In Brazil, the highlight is the Macuco Safari, an exhilarating speedboat trip right into the heart of the falls. In Argentina, the Gran Aventura combines river navigation with a jungle jeep ride. The region also offers stunning helicopter flights, challenging jungle treks, and a visit to Parque das Aves (Brazil), a vital sanctuary for tropical bird species.

winery.title: Winery Tours
winery.desc: Though not a wine-producing region itself, the Frontier’s location is ideal for wine lovers. Its proximity to Argentina grants easy access to superb wines, especially the Malbecs from Mendoza, available for tasting and purchase at specialized wine shops in Puerto Iguazú. For international labels, explore the vast selection at the sophisticated Duty Free Shops along the borders (Brazil/Argentina) and the stores in Ciudad del Este (Paraguay).

shopping.title: Shopping
shopping.desc: The Triple Frontier is a shopper's paradise. Ciudad del Este (Paraguay) is renowned for great deals on electronics, perfumes, and imported goods. In Foz do Iguaçu (Brazil), you can visit modern malls like Catuaí Palladium for fashion, dining, and leisure. For luxury brands and tax-exempt items, the Duty Free Shops in both the Argentine and Brazilian border areas offer a high-end experience.

culture.title: Local Culture
culture.desc: The culture here is a rich blend, forged by the customs of Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina, alongside significant immigrant communities. Visit the Three Borders Landmark (Marco das Três Fronteiras) for views of the river junction and local performances. Foz is known for its religious diversity, home to the striking Chen Tien Buddhist Temple and the Omar Ibn Al-Khattab Muslim Mosque. In Puerto Iguazú and Ciudad del Este, you can experience the unique flavors, handicrafts, and vibrant nightlife of the respective Latin countries.

accordion.step1: Tell us about your trip and your preferences.
accordion.step2: Get sent a customised road trip.

descriptions.step1: It all starts with you. Share your dreams, the length of your stay, your travel style (adventure, relax, culture, or all of the above!), and who you're traveling with. Whether you're a solo explorer, a couple, or a family, this information helps our local experts understand exactly what you need to craft your perfect Iguassu experience.
descriptions.step2: Your personalised itinerary arrives. Based on your input, our Guará experts will design a unique, day-by-day plan covering the Brazilian, Argentinian, and Paraguayan sides of the border. This first draft includes hand-picked accommodations, suggested activities (from the must-see Falls to hidden gems), and efficient transportation options.
descriptions.step3: Fine-tune the details with a local expert. Review the customised itinerary and let us know what you love and what you want to change. Adjust the pace, swap an activity, or upgrade your accommodation. Our specialist is here to make unlimited revisions until your journey is exactly what you envisioned. This is your road trip, we just make it perfect!
descriptions.step4: Confirm, book, and let the adventure begin! Once you are 100% happy with your custom itinerary, we handle all the bookings—hotels, transport, tours, and transfers. All you have to do is pack your bags, arrive in Foz do Iguaçu, and let Guará Travel take care of every detail, ensuring a seamless and unforgettable journey through the Triple Frontier.

inspiration-1.title: How to craft a perfect private road trip in Foz do Iguaçu
inspiration-1.excerpt: From border crossings to hidden viewpoints—build an itinerary that blends wonder, comfort, and authenticity.

inspiration-2.title: Shooting waterfalls: capturing the Iguazu magic at dawn

inspiration-3.title: Yerba mate rituals and border flavors you shouldn’t miss

q1.question: Do I need to cross borders for the Iguazu Falls tours?
q1.answer: To experience the full magic of Iguazu, we recommend visiting both the Brazilian and Argentine sides. Border crossing is straightforward with proper documentation and we guide you through every step.

q2.question: Can you customize tours to my interests and pace?
q2.answer: Absolutely. All tours are customizable — from duration and activities to comfort level. Tell us your preferences and we’ll tailor an itinerary that fits you perfectly.

q3.question: Is it safe to visit the Triple Frontier region?
q3.answer: Yes. We work with trusted local partners and provide guidance on the safest routes and schedules. Private guided tours offer additional comfort and flexibility.

q4.question: What should I bring for the falls and jungle activities?
q4.answer: Comfortable walking shoes, light waterproof jacket, sunscreen, insect repellent, and a waterproof phone pouch are recommended.

q5.question: Do you arrange transport and accommodations?
q5.answer: Yes — we can arrange airport transfers, cross-border transport, and recommend or book hotels that match your style and budget.

q6.question: Can I travel with kids or elderly family members?
q6.answer: Definitely. We adapt activities to different ages and mobility levels, ensuring a comfortable and memorable experience for everyone.

session9.title: REAL AND INDEPENDENT TRAVELLER FEEDBACK
session9.subtitle: Unfiltered, verified reviews from travellers who explored the Triple Frontier with us.

t1.name: Mariana R.
t1.title: A flawless, flexible experience
t1.text: From the Brazilian panoramic trails to the Argentine walkways right over the water – everything was coordinated perfectly. Border crossings were smooth and our guide adapted the pace to my parents. We felt safe and taken care of the whole time.

t2.name: Daniel G.
t2.title: Photography heaven at dawn
t2.text: They knew exactly where to take us for sunrise shots. I got the silky waterfall photos I always wanted. Private transport, zero rush, and some unexpected local food tips too!

t3.name: Sofía M.
t3.title: Authentic and stress-free
t3.text: We visited both sides of the falls and also had time for Yerba mate tasting and a quiet jungle trail. Everything was organised and yet felt spontaneous. Highly recommend!

t4.name: Camille L.
t4.title: Adapted to our style
t4.text: We wanted a relaxed pace with some adventure. They combined Macuco boat with peaceful viewpoints. Communication before and during the trip was excellent.

t5.name: Johannes K.
t5.title: Great cross-border logistics
t5.text: I was worried about documents and timing, but they handled everything seamlessly. We even squeezed in a quick shopping stop in Ciudad del Este.

t6.name: Giulia P.
t6.title: Memorable private tour
t6.text: Our guide shared local stories and the best viewpoints. We avoided crowds and still saw all the highlights. Worth it!

footer.description: Custom private tours across the Triple Frontier — Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay — designed by local experts for unforgettable experiences.

intro.p1: Hello, I'm Paulo Portugal. For years I've been crafting truly bespoke private experiences across the Triple Frontier — Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay. My mission is to blend authenticity and comfort with impeccable logistics and a local eye for every detail of your itinerary.
intro.p2: We work with a carefully selected team of professional guides and drivers, prioritizing safety, punctuality, and flexibility. Whether for couples, families, or small groups, we take care of everything so you can simply enjoy.

list.title: Travel Inspiration
list.subtitle: Stories, tips, and guides from the Triple Frontier.

sidebar.title: Plan your private tour
sidebar.desc: Ready to turn inspiration into an itinerary? Our local experts will tailor a private trip across Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay.

body: From border crossings to hidden viewpoints, here’s how to shape a private road trip that balances wonder and comfort.
Start by mapping the must-sees on both sides of the falls. Build in time for sunrise photography and quieter jungle trails.
Golden hour at Iguazu is magic. Use a tripod or stabilisation, keep ISO low, and experiment with longer exposures for silky water.
Respect mist and spray—protect your gear and be mindful of other visitors on narrow platforms.
Mate is more than a drink—it’s ritual and community. Try traditional yerba blends and pair them with local street bites.
Cross-border flavors tell the story of migration and shared culture across the Triple Frontier.
Beyond the main trails, the region offers calm paths and secret viewpoints. Butterflies, mist, and forest canopies set the scene.
Hire a local guide to reach lesser-known spots safely and responsibly.
